ThingDef.label: aura
ThingDef.description: The Aura, also known as Avenging Angels, are angel-shaped mechanoids surrounded by a whirling cloud of six levitating metallic blades. They favour close combat, approaching their victims and engulfing them in an eviscerating whirlwind of slashing death. They also have the ability to regenerate their wounds with fast acting mechanites. This particular unit appears to be freshly manufactured and will operate more robustly.\n\nNOTE: all Alpha Mechanoids can be disabled from raids, ships and clusters by Mod Options. This can be used even if they have already spawned.

ThingDef.label: daggersnout
ThingDef.description: The daggersnout is a fast, insectlike combat mechanoid armed with a vicious sharp blade on its head. It isn't as dangerous as other close-ranged mechanoids, such as scythers, but they usually appear in greater numbers. This particular unit appears to be freshly manufactured and will operate more robustly.\n\nNOTE: all Alpha Mechanoids can be disabled from raids, ships and clusters by Mod Options. This can be used even if they have already spawned.

ThingDef.label: fireworm
ThingDef.description:
A huge mechanical worm armed with a dangerous chemfuel flamethrower. Their weapon has a very short range, so don't let a fireworm approach your defenses!

The fireworm superficially resembles a Frostbound Behemoth. A coincidence? Or perhaps mechanoids take living things as a blueprint for their units. If so, you wouldn't want to see what a biological scyther looks like... This particular unit appears to be freshly manufactured and will operate more robustly.

NOTE: all Alpha Mechanoids can be disabled from raids, ships and clusters by Mod Options. This can be used even if they have already spawned.

ThingDef.label: goliath
ThingDef.description: The Goliath is a heavy combat mechanoid with a humanoid body plan. They are faster than centipedes, and are usually armed with heavy mechanoid weapons or needle guns. This particular unit appears to be freshly manufactured and will operate more robustly.\n\nNOTE: all Alpha Mechanoids can be disabled from raids, ships and clusters by Mod Options. This can be used even if they have already spawned.

ThingDef.label: phalanx
ThingDef.description:
A bulking mechanoid based on a rhinoceros beetle body plan. The phalanx's plasteel carapace hides a very powerful cryogenic engine capable of constantly producing compacted pellets of supercooled gas. These are fired from an aperture at the mechanoid's head.

This cryo-weapon has a very low range, but it can be very dangerous for beings susceptible to frostbite. This particular unit appears to be freshly manufactured and will operate more robustly.

NOTE: all Alpha Mechanoids can be disabled from raids, ships and clusters by Mod Options. This can be used even if they have already spawned.

ThingDef.label: siegebreaker
ThingDef.description: The siegebreaker is a particularly dangerous tank-shaped mechanoid. Armed with a Siegebreaker Cannon that fires explosives shells, they can detect a hostile presence from hundreds of meters away, acting as unrelenting siege weapons that can obliterate even the strongest defense. Their movement is incredibly slow, and their cannon takes a very long time to recharge, but they should be treated as priority targets in most cases. This particular unit appears to be freshly manufactured and will operate more robustly.\n\nNOTE: all Alpha Mechanoids can be disabled from raids, ships and clusters by Mod Options. This can be used even if they have already spawned.

ThingDef.label: dominion
ThingDef.description: An improved and strengthened version of the Aura, a Dominion is an angel-shaped mechanoid surrounded by a whirling cloud of six levitating metallic blades. They favour close combat, approaching their victims and engulfing them in an eviscerating whirlwind of slashing death. They also have the ability to regenerate their wounds with fast acting mechanites. Unlike their more ancient and less advanced relatives this particular unit is much more intelligent and will seek cover and prove to be a much more challenging opponent in melee combat.\n\nNOTE: all Alpha Mechanoids can be disabled from raids, ships and clusters by Mod Options. This can be used even if they have already spawned.

ThingDef.label: eviscerator
ThingDef.description: The eviscerator is a more advanced version of the daggersnout, an insectlike combat mechanoid armed with a vicious sharp blade on its head. It isn't as dangerous as other close-ranged mechanoids, such as scythers, but they usually appear in greater numbers. Unlike their more ancient and less advanced relatives this particular unit is much more intelligent and will seek cover and prove to be a much more challenging opponent in melee combat.\n\nNOTE: all Alpha Mechanoids can be disabled from raids, ships and clusters by Mod Options. This can be used even if they have already spawned.

ThingDef.label: incinerator
ThingDef.description:
The Incinerator is an advanced version of the Fireworm, a huge mechanical worm armed with a dangerous chemfuel flamethrower. Their weapon has a very short range, so don't let an incinerator approach your defenses!

The incinerator superficially resembles a Frostbound Behemoth. A coincidence? Or perhaps mechanoids take living things as a blueprint for their units. If so, you wouldn't want to see what a biological scyther looks like... Unlike their more ancient and less advanced relatives this particular unit is much more intelligent and will seek cover and prove to be a much more challenging opponent in melee combat.

NOTE: all Alpha Mechanoids can be disabled from raids, ships and clusters by Mod Options. This can be used even if they have already spawned.

ThingDef.label: colossus
ThingDef.description: The Colossus is an advanced version of the Goliath, a heavy combat mechanoid with a humanoid body plan. They are faster than centipedes, and are usually armed with heavy mechanoid weapons or needle guns. Unlike their more ancient and less advanced relatives this particular unit is much more intelligent and will seek cover and prove to be a much more challenging opponent in melee combat.\n\nNOTE: all Alpha Mechanoids can be disabled from raids, ships and clusters by Mod Options. This can be used even if they have already spawned.

ThingDef.label: hoplite
ThingDef.description:
The Hoplite is an advanced version of the Phalanx, a bulking mechanoid based on a rhinoceros beetle body plan. The hoplite's plasteel carapace hides a very powerful cryogenic engine capable of constantly producing compacted pellets of supercooled gas. These are fired from an aperture at the mechanoid's head.

This cryo-weapon has a very low range, but it can be very dangerous for beings susceptible to frostbite. Unlike their more ancient and less advanced relatives this particular unit is much more intelligent and will seek cover and prove to be a much more challenging opponent in melee combat.

NOTE: all Alpha Mechanoids can be disabled from raids, ships and clusters by Mod Options. This can be used even if they have already spawned.

ThingDef.label: siegemaster
ThingDef.description: The Siegemaster is an advanced version of the Siegebreaker, a particularly dangerous tank-shaped mechanoid. Armed with a Siegebreaker Cannon that fires explosives shells, they can detect a hostile presence from hundreds of meters away, acting as unrelenting siege weapons that can obliterate even the strongest defense. Their movement is incredibly slow, and their cannon takes a very long time to recharge, but they should be treated as priority targets in most cases. Unlike their more ancient and less advanced relatives this particular unit is much more intelligent and will seek cover and prove to be a much more challenging opponent in melee combat.\n\nNOTE: all Alpha Mechanoids can be disabled from raids, ships and clusters by Mod Options. This can be used even if they have already spawned.

ThingDef.label: slurrymaster
ThingDef.description: The Slurrymaster is an advanced version of the Slurrypede. This extremely rare bio-mechanical creature is the result of a batch of mechanoids receiving a hardware upgrade. The Slurrymaster is a modified bio-mechanoid capable of devouring almost anything and processing it into a homogeneous organic slurry. This slurry is virtually indistinguishable from nutrient paste produced in a nutrient paste dispenser.\n\nSlurrymasters are docile, almost never hostile, and in case a mechanoid landed ship is destroyed and one of them manages to survive, they tend to roam the wilderness aimlessly, consuming any organic material in their path and turning it into nutrient paste.
